pullRequest.body:
Next parts from PR #15524: relating `height` to 0, ⊤, ⊥, coe.

From the Carleson project

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c2e19ab716](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19028/commits/c2e19ab7169cb4aad9730962fe04209af5ccf6c2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_lt_height_iff`
`+ height_bot`
`+ height_eq_coe_add_one_iff`
`+ height_eq_coe_iff`
`+ height_eq_top_iff`
`+ height_eq_zero`
`+ ⟨_,`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>
It's worrying that these are not one-liners from the complete lattice API. Are we missing API for locally finite complete lattices? (except `ENat` is not actually locally finite everywhere, hmm...)

```suggestion
lemma height_eq_zero_iff {x : α} : height x = 0 ↔ IsMin x := by
```
and I would think that the `_iff` is inferrable
```suggestion
lemma height_eq_zero {x : α} : height x = 0 ↔ IsMin x := by
```

There are lemmas like
```
lemma height_eq_zero_iff_isMin (a : α) :
    IsMin a ↔ height a = 0 := by
```
coming up next (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15524/files#diff-f01f6dfbb94ae0c3a2d89d315b11b5fa88e9f864823c53d72130a3fe82adefb9R462). I guess then I can just delete this?
Included it here, as I need it below.

`Iff` is a structure so you get to do
```suggestion
    n < height x ↔ ∃ y, y < x ∧ height y = n where
  mp h := by
    obtain ⟨m, hx : height x = m⟩ := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp (LT.lt.ne_top hfin)
    rw [hx] at h; norm_cast at h
    obtain ⟨p, hp, hlen⟩ := exists_series_of_height_eq_coe x hx
    use p ⟨n, by omega⟩
    constructor
    · rw [← hp]
      apply LTSeries.strictMono
      simp [Fin.last]; omega
    · exact height_eq_index_of_length_eq_height_last (by simp [hlen, hp, hx]) ⟨n, by omega⟩
  mpr := by
    intro ⟨y, hyx, hy⟩
    exact hy ▸ height_strictMono hyx (lt_of_le_of_lt (height_mono hyx.le) hfin)
```

```suggestion
lemma coe_lt_height_iff (x : α) (n : ℕ) (hfin : height x < ⊤) :
```

```suggestion
    height x = ⊤ ↔ ∀ n, ∃ p : LTSeries α, p.last = x ∧ p.length = n where
  mp h n := by
    apply exists_series_of_le_height x (n := n)
```
if you like

```suggestion
lemma coe_lt_height_iff {x : α} {n : ℕ} (hfin : height x < ⊤) :
```
since it's an iff. Same everywhere else

```suggestion
    obtain ⟨m, hx : height x = m⟩ := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp hfin.ne_top
```

Can you avoid starting newlines in the middle of an inlined statement?
```suggestion
lemma height_eq_coe_add_one_iff (x : α) (n : ℕ) :
    height x = n + 1 ↔ height x < ⊤ ∧ (∃ y < x, height y = n) ∧ (∀ y < x, height y ≤ n) := by
```
same below
The one below needs a linebreak somewhere, hopefully better now.

```suggestion
      height x < ⊤ ∧ (n = 0 ∨ ∃ y < x, height y = n - 1) ∧ (∀ y < x, height y < n) := by
```
Does it still need a linebreak with that?

pullRequest.title: feat(KrullDimension): height and 0, ⊤, ⊥, coe
